translation.en: -[Ghareeb, in Arabic] Mr. Hamada! -[Hamada] Yes, boss?
translation.ja: 〈ハマーダ〉 〈何だ？〉

translation.en: [Ghareeb] There's something down there.
translation.ja: 〈下に何かある〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Hold on, Ghareeb, I'm coming down.
translation.ja: 〈今 下りる〉

translation.en: [Ghareeb] It's over there.
translation.ja: 〈そこだ〉

translation.en: [Hamada] What are we looking at?
translation.ja: 〈何だ？〉

translation.en: [Ghareeb] Over there… something has appeared.
translation.ja: 〈そこに何か出てきた〉

translation.en: [Hamada] My God, the dust!
translation.ja: 〈ああ 何かある！〉

translation.en: [Ghareeb] That's why I stopped. I can't tell what it is.
translation.ja: 〈それで手を止めたんだ 何だろう？〉

translation.en: It's in that pile of dirt.
translation.ja: 〈土の中だ〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Okay, give me some room.
translation.ja: 〈通してくれ〉

translation.en: In the name of God. What's this then?
translation.ja: 〈これは いったい何だ？〉

translation.en: This is something astonishing…
translation.ja: 〈これは すごい〉

translation.en: It's the lion goddess, Ghareeb!
translation.ja: 〈ライオンの女神だ〉

translation.en: [Ghareeb] Wow!
translation.ja: 〈驚いた〉

translation.en: [Hamada] What in the name of God is this doing here?
translation.ja: 〈なぜ こんな所に？〉

translation.en: [man, in English] To discover a complete tomb…
translation.ja: 完全な状態の墓なんて―

translation.en: it is incredible.
translation.ja: すごい発見だ

translation.en: [in Arabic] The first time I went in, I nearly passed out from sheer joy!
translation.ja: 〈最初に中へ入った時は うれしくて倒れそうだった〉

translation.en: [in English] Four thousand years old, hidden!
translation.ja: ４千年間 眠ってたんだ

translation.en: -[Ahmed, in English] Nobody touch it. -[man continues speaking Arabic]
translation.ja: 誰も触れていない

translation.en: [in Arabic] An unfathomable tomb!
translation.ja: 〈謎めいた墓だ〉

translation.en: There is absolutely nothing like this.
translation.ja: 〈他に類を見ない〉

translation.en: [newsman] An ancient story is coming to life from under the desert sands west of Cairo.
translation.ja: カイロ近郊の砂漠から 古代の墓が見つかりました

translation.en: [newsman 2] What's being called a one-of-a-kind discovery in Egypt.
translation.ja: 珍しい発見だということです

translation.en: [newsman 3] …a tomb so perfectly preserved, it's been called the most significant discovery in decades.
translation.ja: 完全な保存状態の墓で 数十年に一度の大発見です

translation.en: [newswoman] Untouched and unlooted for 4,400 years.
translation.ja: ４千４百年間 手付かずのままでした

translation.en: Newspapers, magazines, TVs.
translation.ja: 新聞も雑誌もテレビも―

translation.en: Everybody in the world, they were talking about the tomb.
translation.ja: 〝４４００年前の 未盗掘の墓を発見〞 〝４４００年前の 未盗掘の墓を発見〞 世界中が大騒ぎしていた

translation.en: A rare discovery in Egypt.
translation.ja: 〝エジプトで新発見〞 エジプト考古相は―

translation.en: The Antiquities minister says they uncovered a private tomb
translation.ja: 〝エジプトで新発見〞 エジプト考古相は― 第５王朝の王に仕えた 高官の墓が発見されたと発表

translation.en: belonging to a senior official from the fifth dynasty of the pharaohs.
translation.ja: 第５王朝の王に仕えた 高官の墓が発見されたと発表

translation.en: [newswoman] …it's the latest in a series of big finds in Egypt.
translation.ja: 大発見が続いています

translation.en: [newsman] The head of Egypt's Antiquities Council says more discoveries are expected…
translation.ja: エジプト考古相は 更なる調査を進めると…

translation.en: [newsman 2] …is exceptionally well-preserved and can offer more understanding of life back then.
translation.ja: その時代について より深く 知る手がかりになりそうです

translation.en: [Mohammad] This tomb… is a unique tomb.
translation.ja: この墓は― 独特だ

translation.en: To find this color…
translation.ja: 見事な色彩

translation.en: to find this inscription…
translation.ja: 刻まれた碑文

translation.en: and all these statues in a private tomb?
translation.ja: 彫像の数々が個人の墓に？

translation.en: It doesn't appear before in all Egypt.
translation.ja: エジプトでも他にない

translation.en: My name is Mohammad Mohammad Yousef. I am a doctor in Egyptology.
translation.ja: 私はムハンマド･ユーセフ エジプト学の博士だ

translation.en: From the beginning when we discover the tomb, we found the name Wahtye.
translation.ja: 墓を見つけてすぐ ワフティーという名前を発見

translation.en: Wahtye is the owner of the tomb.
translation.ja: ワフティーは この墓の主だが―

translation.en: But we don't know anything about this man.
translation.ja: どういう人物かは不明だ

translation.en: We must read the hieroglyphics to find out…
translation.ja: ヒエログリフを解読し―

translation.en: Who is Wahtye? Who is he to have a tomb like this?
translation.ja: この見事な墓の主の正体を 解明しなければいけない

translation.en: It is a mystery.
translation.ja: 謎解きだ

translation.en: Usually when we find a tomb,
translation.ja: 通常 このような墓には―

translation.en: somebody digs the burial shaft in the ancient times.
translation.ja: 埋葬用の竪穴が掘られている

translation.en: But sometimes you have a surprise.
translation.ja: そこに驚きが待っていた

translation.en: When we cleaned the ground,
translation.ja: 地面を掃いたら―

translation.en: we found four shafts filled with sand.
translation.ja: 砂の詰まった竪穴が ４つ見つかった

translation.en: And that day, everybody didn't sleep. We dream.
translation.ja: その日は期待が膨らみ 眠れなかった

translation.en: Because if we can find the whole family buried in the shafts after 4,500 years,
translation.ja: ４千５百年前に埋葬された 家族を見つけられたら―

translation.en: that would be better than finding gold.
translation.ja: それは黄金より価値がある

translation.en: It would be incredible for us.
translation.ja: 我々にとっては うれしいことだ

translation.en: [Hamada] My name is Hamada Mansour.
translation.ja: 〈僕はハマーダ･マンソア〉

translation.en: I'm an archaeologist
translation.ja: 〈考古学者だ〉

translation.en: and a member of the Egyptian mission at the Bubasteion necropolis.
translation.ja: 〈ブバステイオン墓地の 発掘チームのメンバーだ〉

translation.en: Mr. Ahmed Zikrey is my supervisor.
translation.ja: 〈アハメド･ジクリは上司〉

translation.en: He was also the person who taught me history in primary school.
translation.ja: 〈僕の小学校の 歴史の先生だった〉

translation.en: -You're late. -[Hamada] Sorry, boss.
translation.ja: 〈遅い〉 〈ごめんなさい〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Every day, we start our journey…
translation.ja: 〈毎日 僕らは旅に出る〉

translation.en: from the world of the living…
translation.ja: 〈生者の世界から―〉

translation.en: to the world of the dead…
translation.ja: 〈死者の世界である―〉

translation.en: Saqqara.
translation.ja: 〈サッカラへ〉

translation.en: [Ahmed] Working at Saqqara,
translation.ja: サッカラで―

translation.en: I'm so lucky, because I love the history so much.
translation.ja: 発掘に携われて幸運だ

translation.en: In just minutes, you can go from the green, and people, crowded…
translation.ja: 緑が生い茂り 人々が集まる場所を出ると―

translation.en: suddenly to be in the desert.
translation.ja: すぐに砂漠だ

translation.en: It is amazing.
translation.ja: 驚くよ

translation.en: [Hamada] Saqqara is a magical place.
translation.ja: 〈サッカラは―〉

translation.en: The secret of its enchantment
translation.ja: 〈謎に満ちた 魅力的な場所だ〉

translation.en: is that under its sands are treasures dating back more than 5,000 years.
translation.ja: 〈５千年以上前の宝が 土に埋もれてる〉

translation.en: All in the shadow of the Step Pyramid,
translation.ja: 〈世界最古の ピラミッドである―〉

translation.en: the oldest stone pyramid in the world.
translation.ja: 〈階段ピラミッドもある〉

translation.en: [in English] For me, Saqqara is the most important archaeological site in Egypt.
translation.ja: エジプト考古学において 最も重要な遺跡だと思う

translation.en: Any Egyptologist must come to Saqqara to learn
translation.ja: ここに来れば 古代エジプトの―

translation.en: the history from the beginning till the end.
translation.ja: 始まりから終わりまで学べる

translation.en: [Hamada] The Bubasteion necropolis, where we found Wahtye's tomb,
translation.ja: 〈ワフティーの墓がある ブバステイオン墓地は―〉

translation.en: is an ancient cemetery by the eastern cliffs,
translation.ja: 〈東側の崖にある 古代の墓地だ〉

translation.en: less than a kilometer from the Step Pyramid.
translation.ja: 〈階段ピラミッドから １キロ弱〉

translation.en: We began our excavation here in the spring of 2018.
translation.ja: 〈発掘調査を始めたのは 2018年の春だった〉

translation.en: The whole team is Egyptian…
translation.ja: 〈チームは全員エジプト人〉

translation.en: But it's tough to work in these conditions.
translation.ja: 〈労働環境は過酷だ〉

translation.en: If the weather down in the city is 26 degrees,
translation.ja: 〈カイロの気温が 摂氏26度の時は―〉

translation.en: it's 32 or 33 degrees up here. [chuckles]
translation.ja: 〈こっちは33度ぐらいだ〉

translation.en: It's exhausting work…
translation.ja: 〈すごく重労働だ〉

translation.en: and, my God, the dust!
translation.ja: 〈砂ぼこりが邪魔をする〉

translation.en: But we are the people who can best give a voice to our ancestors,
translation.ja: 〈でもここに眠るのは 僕たちの先祖だ〉

translation.en: because they are our ancestors. We are one step closer to them than the foreigner.
translation.ja: 〈海外の人よりは 僕たちのほうが近しい〉

translation.en: Mr. Sabry is the General Manager.
translation.ja: 〈サブリ氏は総責任者だ〉

translation.en: He keeps the whole operation running.
translation.ja: 〈全ての作業を 管理するため―〉

translation.en: Him and his family practically live here!
translation.ja: 〈家族と ほぼ ここに住んでる〉

translation.en: Foreman Mustafa is in charge of the workers.
translation.ja: 〈現場監督のムスタファは 全作業員を統率してる〉

translation.en: [Hamada] We'll put a group here, Foreman Mustafa.
translation.ja: 〈ここにチームを？〉

translation.en: -[Mustafa] Yes. -[Hamada] Group number one.
translation.ja: 〈ああ〉 〈第１チーム〉

translation.en: [Hamada] And Dr. Mohammad Yousef is the site director.
translation.ja: 〈ユーセフ博士は 調査の責任者〉

translation.en: I admire his reputation as an archaeologist,
translation.ja: 〈優れた考古学者である彼に ついて回り―〉

translation.en: so I always stick close in order to learn from him.
translation.ja: 〈優れた考古学者である彼に ついて回り―〉 〈多くを学んでる〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] Since we discovered the tomb, we are waiting to dig the shafts
translation.ja: 竪穴を掘り返す日を ずっと待っていた

translation.en: to complete our story for Wahtye and his family.
translation.ja: 墓について もっと知るためにね

translation.en: But until this moment, we are not able to work inside the… the tomb.
translation.ja: 許可が出るまで 墓の中での作業はできない

translation.en: Because first we need to investigate the story of Wahtye through what is written on the walls.
translation.ja: まずは壁のヒエログリフを 解読することが先決だった

translation.en: [in Arabic] Let's start working around the frame.
translation.ja: 〈その辺りから 始めましょう〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] Around three months, we are waiting,
translation.ja: ３ヵ月ほど待った

translation.en: but we haven't stopped working outside.
translation.ja: その間も休まず 外で―

translation.en: Our main aim here is to find a new tomb.
translation.ja: 新しい墓を探していた

translation.en: -[men speaking indistinctly] -We discovered Wahtye, so maybe we will discover another tomb in this area.
translation.ja: ワフティーの墓以外にも あるかもしれない

translation.en: It is a theory. Maybe it's right, maybe it's not right.
translation.ja: 本当にあるかは分からない

translation.en: But we need to finish the work in this area
translation.ja: 発掘シーズンが終わる前に このエリアを―

translation.en: before the end of the season.
translation.ja: 調べ尽くしたかった

translation.en: [Ahmed] We have hundreds of people working at the mission.
translation.ja: 作業員は数百人いる

translation.en: It is the only source of income for them.
translation.ja: 彼らの唯一の収入源だ

translation.en: All the team are hoping for next season.
translation.ja: みんな次のシーズンに 期待してる

translation.en: But everybody not sure that they come back again or no,
translation.ja: でも戻ってこられる保証は ないんだ

translation.en: because maybe no money from the government this time.
translation.ja: 政府が予算を 出さないかもしれない

translation.en: We are sure we can find something,
translation.ja: 絶対 何かある

translation.en: but the ti… the time is running. Ramadan is coming.
translation.ja: でもラマダンまで時間がない

translation.en: So we need to find something to complete our work.
translation.ja: 発掘を続けるために 何か見つけなきゃ

translation.en: [Hamada, in Arabic] What is it, Mahrous? Hmm?
translation.ja: 〈何だ マフロー〉

translation.en: Let me see.
translation.ja: 〈見せてみろ〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] Have you got something?
translation.ja: 〈何かあった？〉

translation.en: Move your hand, Mahrous, move your hand.
translation.ja: 〈手を動かせ マフロー〉

translation.en: -[Hamada] Hold it from the top! -[Mohammad] Go Tamer! Sweep.
translation.ja: 〈いいぞ タマー　掃け〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] It is a base of a statue.
translation.ja: 像の土台だ

translation.en: "May Ptah give…"
translation.ja: “プタハ神よ…”

translation.en: -"All life…" -"…uh, all… all life… give all health…
translation.ja: “生命… 完全な健康体を与えたまえ”

translation.en: all life to…"
translation.ja: “生命の全てを…”

translation.en: The name here. The name, the beginning of the name, is not clear.
translation.ja: 名前が書かれてるが 前半部分が不明瞭だ

translation.en: [Hamada, in Arabic] I've got a feeling she is not human.
translation.ja: 〈人間じゃないのでは？〉

translation.en: -Ah. -[Hamda] It could be Sekhmet.
translation.ja: 〈セクメトの可能性も〉

translation.en: We need the other part to read the rest.
translation.ja: 〈残りの部分も探そう〉

translation.en: [Hamada] That would be good.
translation.ja: 〈そうだね〉

translation.en: -[Mohammad] That's your job, Mr. Hamada. -Yes, boss!
translation.ja: 〈頼んだよ〉 〈ああ 博士〉

translation.en: [man] It's very beautiful!
translation.ja: 〈すばらしい〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Dr. Mohammad, this statue is very unusual.
translation.ja: 〈とても変わった像だ〉

translation.en: -We found the base first, then the body. -[Mohammad] Oh.
translation.ja: 〈土台が先に見つかり その後 胴体も発見〉

translation.en: -Oh. -[Hamada] It fits perfectly.
translation.ja: 〈ピッタリ〉

translation.en: We carried on working and we found the head.
translation.ja: 〈頭部も見つけた〉

translation.en: There are some beautiful statues here.
translation.ja: 〈美しい像だらけだ〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] We're close to where the temple was.
translation.ja: 〈神殿跡に近いんだ〉

translation.en: [woman] We've known that the eastern cliffs of Saqqara
translation.ja: サッカラの東側の崖は―

translation.en: were actually the space where there were major animal cult centers.
translation.ja: 動物信仰の中心地だったと 分かっている

translation.en: And one of the most important was the Bubasteion.
translation.ja: ブバステイオンは 重要な場所の１つ

translation.en: My name is Salima Ikram,
translation.ja: サリマ 私はサリマ･イクラム 私はサリマ･イクラム

translation.en: and I am a funerary archaeologist and an archaeozoologist.
translation.ja: ミイラなどを専門とする 考古学者よ

translation.en: This part is important. This is not.
translation.ja: 〈これは重要　これは違う〉

translation.en: [in English] One of my specialties is animal mummies.
translation.ja: 動物のミイラも専門の１つ

translation.en: -[man speaking Arabic] -[in Arabic] My dear, a little this way.
translation.ja: 〈少し こっちに〉

translation.en: [Salima] The Bubasteion was a cult center and temple
translation.ja: ブバステイオンは 信仰の中心地で―

translation.en: devoted to the goddess Bastet.
translation.ja: バステトを祭る神殿が

translation.en: She is the goddess of motherhood, beauty, and love,
translation.ja: 母性や美 愛を象徴する女神で―

translation.en: most commonly seen as a cat or a woman with a cat's head.
translation.ja: 猫の姿か 猫の頭部を持った 女性の姿をしてる

translation.en: [Ahmed, in Arabic] I really love these small cats.
translation.ja: 〈この小さな猫たち かわいい〉

translation.en: -[Mohammad] Small is beautiful, Mr. Ahmed. -[man speaking Arabic]
translation.ja: 〈美しいわよね〉

translation.en: [Salima, in English] Like any Egyptian goddess, Bastet has a calm side and a scary side.
translation.ja: 他のエジプトの女神同様 バステトにも２つの顔が

translation.en: On the calm side, she's a pussycat,
translation.ja: １つは おとなしくて 優しくて明るく―

translation.en: and so she'll be nice and playful and she'll sort of look after her kittens.
translation.ja: １つは おとなしくて 優しくて明るく― 子猫の世話をする顔

translation.en: -[Salima] Oh, look, it's a kitten. -[man] Yeah.
translation.ja: 見て　子猫がいる

translation.en: [in Arabic] Humerus bone, there are two,
translation.ja: 〈これら２本が上腕骨〉

translation.en: and the radius. -That's the radius there. -[man speaking Arabic]
translation.ja: 〈そして とう骨が… ああ これがそうだわ〉

translation.en: But the scary side, she's a lioness.
translation.ja: 一方 怖いライオンの顔も

translation.en: [Salima, in English] And she is the goddess of revenge and plagues,
translation.ja: 復讐や伝染病を もたらす女神でもあったの

translation.en: and she's called Sekhmet in that guise.
translation.ja: そっちの姿の時はセクメト

translation.en: [Hamada] Be careful with that mattock.
translation.ja: 〈つるはしに注意を〉

translation.en: [Ahmed] What is it? Sekhmet?
translation.ja: 〈それはセクメト？〉

translation.en: [Hamada] God willing!
translation.ja: 〈多分な〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Wow, a great example!
translation.ja: 〈すばらしい状態だ〉

translation.en: [in English] Words, uh, saying, "To Sekhmet, beloved of god Ptah,
translation.ja: こう書かれてる “プタハ神よ”

translation.en: may he give her all the health
translation.ja: “セクメトに完全な健康体と 喜びの全てを―”

translation.en: and all the pleasure, like Ra forever."
translation.ja: “ラーのごとく 永遠に与えたまえ”

translation.en: -[man speaking Arabic] -Beautiful.
translation.ja: 〈すばらしい〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] To be the first one to hold something in your hand after thousands of years…
translation.ja: 何千年前の物を 最初に手に取ることができる

translation.en: Millions of people dream to do this work.
translation.ja: この仕事に憧れる人は多い

translation.en: We are working here, but we are ready at any time to move quickly
translation.ja: 外で作業してるけど 墓の内部の作業にも―

translation.en: to work inside the tomb.
translation.ja: すぐに移れる

translation.en: We dream to finish the story of Wahtye.
translation.ja: ワフティーのことが知りたい

translation.en: Who is this man?
translation.ja: 彼は誰なのか

translation.en: "Purified Priest to the King."
translation.ja: 〈“王に仕えた神官”〉

translation.en: Purified Priest to the King? Where's "the King?"
translation.ja: 〈王の名前はどこだろう？〉

translation.en: "The King" is right there. See it?
translation.ja: 〈ここね　分かる？〉

translation.en: But it's eroded.
translation.ja: 〈崩れてる〉

translation.en: [Nabil] You're right.
translation.ja: 〈なるほど〉

translation.en: -Can you see it now? -Exactly. Good point.
translation.ja: 〈いい指摘だ〉

translation.en: [Nermeen] When we are about to read a hieroglyphic text, there are certain rules that we follow.
translation.ja: 〈ヒエログリフを読むには 従うべきルールがある〉

translation.en: These are remnants of the symbol for "Divine Estate,"
translation.ja: 〈神聖な土地を表す 文字の名残かしら〉

translation.en: -or is it just my imagination? -[Nabil] These are remnants of…
translation.ja: 〈神聖な土地を表す 文字の名残かしら〉 〈確かに これはそうだね〉

translation.en: -[Nermeen] Of "Divine Estate." -[Nabil] "Divine Estate."
translation.ja: 〈確かに これはそうだね〉

translation.en: The writing can go from right to left, left to right,
translation.ja: 〈読む方向は 右から左 左から右〉

translation.en: from top to bottom, or even the opposite.
translation.ja: 〈上から下 下から上もある〉

translation.en: -After this horizontal row of hieroglyphs… -[Nermeen] Ah.
translation.ja: 〈この横書きの列のあとに 来るのが―〉

translation.en: [Nabil] …it's then this northern frame and these vertical inscriptions.
translation.ja: 〈この縦書きの枠じゃ ないかな〉

translation.en: So the whole idea is we figure out what direction it's going in.
translation.ja: 〈どの方向に書かれてるか 割り出す作業よ〉

translation.en: [Nabil] The simple trick is to look for the bird.
translation.ja: 〈簡単な方法は鳥を 見つけることだ〉

translation.en: If he faces right, we start from the right.
translation.ja: 〈鳥が右向きなら右から左〉

translation.en: If he faces left, we start from the left. Then we see if we can make sense of it.
translation.ja: 〈左向きなら左から読むと 意味も通るの〉

translation.en: [Nermeen] I think it's "Revered with…"
translation.ja: 〈“崇拝”じゃない？〉

translation.en: because this part is the rest of the phonetic symbol
translation.ja: 〈この部分が 文字の名残で―〉

translation.en: for "'Revered," these three together.
translation.ja: 〈この３つで“崇拝”〉

translation.en: -Followed by "the Great God." -[Nabil] Right, right.
translation.ja: 〈次が“偉大な神”〉

translation.en: [Nermeen] Okay, let's read it?
translation.ja: 〈読んでみましょう〉

translation.en: -This is very clear. -[Nabil] Hmm.
translation.ja: 〈意味が分かる〉

translation.en: Did you write that?
translation.ja: 〈それ君の字？〉

translation.en: Improve your handwriting a little for when you're reading. Improve your handwriting. I beg you!
translation.ja: 〈もう少し キレイに書きなよ〉

translation.en: This is how I write. All geniuses are like that.
translation.ja: 〈天才は皆こうよ〉

translation.en: -How can you read this? -I'm the only one who can.
translation.ja: 〈読めない〉 〈私しか読めないの〉

translation.en: [Nermeen] That's where the joy comes from.
translation.ja: 〈いろいろ考察して―〉

translation.en: Every aspect we discuss will lift the veil on who Wahtye was.
translation.ja: 〈ワフティーの人物像が 見えてきて うれしい〉

translation.en: And as the basis of everything, we must consider Wahtye as a priest.
translation.ja: 〈神官だったということが いろんなヒントになる〉

translation.en: The priest in that period was considered one of the highest officials.
translation.ja: 〈その時代 神官は非常に 地位の高い官職だった〉

translation.en: He was the middleman
translation.ja: 〈王と民や―〉

translation.en: between the king and the people, and between the king and his god.
translation.ja: 〈王と神の仲介者だったと 考えられる〉

translation.en: That's how he was able to build such a wonderful tomb.
translation.ja: 〈だから立派な墓を 建てられた〉

translation.en: [Nabil] Wahtye, based on my first impression…
translation.ja: 〈僕の印象では ワフティーは―〉

translation.en: I like the guy!
translation.ja: 〈いいヤツだ〉

translation.en: Even if I see him as a bit of an egoist.
translation.ja: 〈少々エゴイストだけどね〉

translation.en: He mentioned his own name a lot in the tomb.
translation.ja: 〈自分の名を 何度も書いてる〉

translation.en: And he put in a lot of statues of himself.
translation.ja: 〈自身の像も たくさん設置〉

translation.en: Fifty-five statues is an immense number!
translation.ja: 〈彫像55体は多い〉

translation.en: He is glorifying himself.
translation.ja: 〈自画自賛してる〉

translation.en: He wanted to say, "I am a strong personality, an important personality."
translation.ja: 〈自分は力のある 重要人物だと言いたいんだ〉

translation.en: He wanted to be transported to the afterlife
translation.ja: 〈そしてあの世に行くことを 望んでる〉

translation.en: in his full strength, with all of his wealth.
translation.ja: 〈現世の権力と富を 持ったままでね〉

translation.en: He depicted an incredible array of activities.
translation.ja: 〈さまざまな壁画もあった〉

translation.en: [Nermeen] We have multiple scenes of daily life…
translation.ja: 〈日常の風景を 描いたものや―〉

translation.en: and religious scenes…
translation.ja: 〈宗教的な壁画もあった〉

translation.en: showing the afterlife.
translation.ja: 〈死後の世界も〉

translation.en: This whole thing is scenes, it's very nice.
translation.ja: 〈これは大作ね〉

translation.en: The scene is magnificent.
translation.ja: 〈壮大だ〉

translation.en: [Nermeen] He cared to portray everything in great detail.
translation.ja: 〈描写が とても細かいの〉

translation.en: [Nabil] This man wanted it all.
translation.ja: 〈全てを―〉

translation.en: He wanted to transfer all of this to his afterlife,
translation.ja: 〈あの世へ 一緒に持っていき―〉

translation.en: and he was saying, "I will be master of all this for eternity."
translation.ja: 〈永久に所有することを 望んでた〉

translation.en: For the ancient Egyptians, because they loved life so much,
translation.ja: 古代エジプト人は 人生を愛し―

translation.en: they wanted to have a fabulous afterlife,
translation.ja: 死後の世界を望んでいた

translation.en: and the best way was to have a very nice tomb.
translation.ja: だから立派な墓を建てたの

translation.en: They would build tomb chapels, which were above ground.
translation.ja: 地上に礼拝所を作り― 地上に礼拝所を作り― 礼拝所

translation.en: And then there would be a shaft connecting to the below-ground bed,
translation.ja: 礼拝所 そこから地中の棺につながる 竪穴を堀り― そこから地中の棺につながる 竪穴を堀り― そこから地中の棺につながる 竪穴を堀り― 埋葬室

translation.en: where you're actually buried.
translation.ja: 埋葬室 埋葬室 そこに安置された

translation.en: Because the idea was you preserve your body so your soul can reanimate it.
translation.ja: 肉体を保存しておけば やがて再生されると信じてた

translation.en: Above ground, the chapel was beautifully decorated
translation.ja: 地上の礼拝所は 美しく装飾され―

translation.en: with all kinds of scenes that showed the ideal life that they wished to enjoy for eternity.
translation.ja: 永久に続いてほしい 理想的な暮らしが描かれた

translation.en: And also, you have things called "false doors,"
translation.ja: また魂が出たり入ったりする 偽扉(ぎひ)というものも作られた また魂が出たり入ったりする 偽扉(ぎひ)というものも作られた ワフティーの偽扉

translation.en: and that's where your soul goes in and out.
translation.ja: また魂が出たり入ったりする 偽扉(ぎひ)というものも作られた ワフティーの偽扉

translation.en: And so, one part of your soul could go into the afterworld.
translation.ja: そこから魂の一部は あの世へ行き―

translation.en: Another part could hang out in your tomb…
translation.ja: 残りは墓にとどまり―

translation.en: [Salima] …and every time someone came in for a chat, you could listen.
translation.ja: 訪れる者の声に 耳を傾けたりできた

translation.en: [Salima] So, this whole tomb complex acted as a kind of resurrection machine
translation.ja: つまり この複雑な墓全体が 再生のための装置だった

translation.en: that guaranteed being able to safely go from this world to the next world
translation.ja: 安全に死後の世界へと 導いてくれて―

translation.en: and to sort of live this fabulous existence for eternity.
translation.ja: 永遠の命を 保証するものだった

translation.en: Incredible!
translation.ja: 〈見事ね〉

translation.en: [Nabil] It is a special tomb.
translation.ja: 〈特別な墓だ〉

translation.en: But in my own personal perspective,
translation.ja: 〈でも僕が思うに―〉

translation.en: uh, this tomb contains a lot of riddles.
translation.ja: 〈この墓には まだまだ たくさんの謎がある〉

translation.en: This is a family tomb, and there are certain characters that are shown,
translation.ja: 〈これは家族の墓で 顔ぶれが紹介されてる〉

translation.en: such as Wahtye and his mother,
translation.ja: 〈ワフティー　母親〉

translation.en: his four children,
translation.ja: 〈４人の子供〉

translation.en: and his wife.
translation.ja: 〈彼の妻〉

translation.en: But some characters are missing.
translation.ja: 〈だが全員じゃない〉

translation.en: He had a brother?
translation.ja: 〈兄弟は？〉

translation.en: Wahtye's name was mentioned so many times. What's the deal?
translation.ja: 〈なぜワフティーの名を 何度も書いたのか〉

translation.en: It's as if he was saying, "This tomb is mine! This tomb is mine, mine, mine!"
translation.ja: 〈まるで墓が自分の物だと 強調してるようだ〉

translation.en: It's too much!
translation.ja: 〈必死すぎる〉

translation.en: I smell the scent of conspiracy in this tomb.
translation.ja: 〈何か裏がありそうだ〉

translation.en: [Mustafa] My name is Foreman Mustafa Abdo Sadek Mahmoud.
translation.ja: 〈私はムスタファ･アブド･ サデック･マハムド〉

translation.en: I am the foreman of excavations at Saqqara.
translation.ja: 〈発掘の現場監督をしてる〉

translation.en: I became a foreman because this is the work of my forefathers.
translation.ja: 〈現場監督になったのは 家族の影響だ〉

translation.en: My father, my grandfather, and my great grandfather were all foremen.
translation.ja: 〈父も祖父も曽祖父も 現場監督だった〉

translation.en: It was passed down to me generation by generation.
translation.ja: 〈代々受け継がれてきた 職業なんだ〉

translation.en: [Mustafa] This is our land.
translation.ja: 〈ここは うちの土地だ〉

translation.en: I come here after I finish work.
translation.ja: 〈仕事のあと 来る〉

translation.en: These trees and palms have been around since the time of the pharaohs.
translation.ja: 〈ファラオの時代から これらの木々はある〉

translation.en: I plant and harvest just like the ancient Egyptians.
translation.ja: 〈当時と同じように 育ててる〉

translation.en: There are many things on Wahtye's walls that I recognize from my daily life.
translation.ja: 〈ワフティーの墓の壁には 今でも見られる光景が〉

translation.en: [Mustafa] People imagine the ancients living in the desert sands because that's where we find them now.
translation.ja: 〈古代エジプト人は砂漠で 暮らしてたと思われがちだ〉

translation.en: But this is the Egypt where Wahtye lived…
translation.ja: 〈でも実際は こういう場所だった〉

translation.en: …and he believed that he could take all this with him.
translation.ja: 〈ワフティーはこの全てを 持っていこうと―〉

translation.en: So he spent his whole life preparing for the next life.
translation.ja: 〈再生の準備に 人生を費やした〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Ancient Egyptians hoped that after death,
translation.ja: 〈古代エジプト人は死後―〉

translation.en: they would live for eternity in the Field of Reeds,
translation.ja: 〈アシの原野で 暮らすことを願った〉

translation.en: which was a lot like the Egypt they knew, only better.
translation.ja: 〈そこは現実世界と ほぼ変わらない〉

translation.en: But to get there, they had to go through a series of tests in the underworld.
translation.ja: 〈でも審査を通らなければ たどり着けない場所だ〉

translation.en: The most important of these tests took place in the hall of judgment before Osiris, god of death and resurrection.
translation.ja: 〈審査は死と再生の神 オシリスの前で行われる〉

translation.en: To get to paradise, the person had to stand in front of 42 judges
translation.ja: 〈42の判事たちの前で 罪を犯していないことを―〉

translation.en: and swear that they had not committed certain sins…
translation.ja: 〈宣言しなければならない〉

translation.en: …and so on.
translation.ja: 〈ウソはついてなく 盗みや殺人も犯してないと〉

translation.en: After that came "the weighing of the heart,"
translation.ja: 〈そして死者の心臓が―〉

translation.en: where the person's heart was weighed against the feather of truth and justice.
translation.ja: 〈“正義と真実の羽根”と てんびんにかけられる〉

translation.en: If the heart was heavier than the feather,
translation.ja: 〈心臓のほうが重ければ―〉

translation.en: it would be eaten by a crocodile-headed demon and the person was lost forever.
translation.ja: 〈ワニの頭の怪物に食べられ ２度と転生できない〉

translation.en: But if the heart and feather were in balance, the person was declared "true of voice"
translation.ja: 〈釣り合った場合は “声正しき者”と称され―〉

translation.en: and the journey to the Field of Reeds could begin.
translation.ja: 〈アシの原野への旅が 許される〉

translation.en: Okay, same time tomorrow, boss?
translation.ja: 〈明日 同じ時間に？〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Right, okay.
translation.ja: 〈ああ〉

translation.en: [Ahmed] Don't be late, boss!
translation.ja: 〈遅刻厳禁だよ！〉

translation.en: [Hamada] All the work that involves danger is my work,
translation.ja: 〈危険な仕事は 全て僕がやる〉

translation.en: because, basically, I'm the only youthful one on the team.
translation.ja: 〈チーム唯一の若者だから〉

translation.en: [Hamada] But I always liked difficult things, not easy ones.
translation.ja: 〈でも困難に挑むのは 好きだ〉

translation.en: [Hamada] The Bubasteion necropolis, I must say…
translation.ja: 〈ブバステイオン墓地は―〉

translation.en: is a very strange place.
translation.ja: 〈不思議な場所だ〉

translation.en: It always gives us what we aren't expecting…
translation.ja: 〈常に予想外のものを 与えてくれる〉

translation.en: [Hamada] And that's a wonderful thing.
translation.ja: 〈だから面白い〉

translation.en: Hey, Ghareeb! In the name of God!
translation.ja: 〈ガリーブ　それは？〉

translation.en: -What are all these? -[Ghareeb] It's strange!
translation.ja: 〈何だ？〉 〈分からない〉

translation.en: [Hamada] In the name of God!
translation.ja: 〈何なんだ？〉

translation.en: No, no, no… What's this?
translation.ja: 〈いやいや ウソだろ？〉

translation.en: -Hmm, they're still in their wrappings. -[Ghareeb] Hmm.
translation.ja: 〈布に包まれたままだ〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Look at this lovely piece, Ghareeb.
translation.ja: 〈これは形がいい〉

translation.en: This fellow I see before me now is a…
translation.ja: 〈これは紛れもなく…〉

translation.en: cat!
translation.ja: 〈猫だ！〉

translation.en: -See how many there are, Ghareeb? -[Ghareeb] Yeah.
translation.ja: 〈何体ぐらいあるだろう〉

translation.en: [Hamada] So many!
translation.ja: 〈たくさんあるね〉

translation.en: Are these all cats?
translation.ja: 〈全部 猫？〉

translation.en: -Where did they get them from? -[Ghareeb] I have no idea.
translation.ja: 〈どこから来た？〉 〈さあな〉

translation.en: But there are so many cats, it's really shocking.
translation.ja: 〈すごくたくさんいて 衝撃的だ〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Hello!
translation.ja: 〈やあ！〉

translation.en: What's this, then?
translation.ja: 〈これは？〉

translation.en: Is this supposed to be a cat, Ghareeb? Well, look!
translation.ja: 〈大きいけど これも猫かな〉

translation.en: Oh, my days!
translation.ja: 〈これは驚いた〉

translation.en: In the name of God! This is no cat, Ghareeb!
translation.ja: 〈何てこった これは猫じゃない〉

translation.en: Let's take it into the light.
translation.ja: 〈明るい所へ〉

translation.en: -[Ghareeb] This is something… -[Hamada] Something astonishing.
translation.ja: 〈それは…〉 〈期待できる〉

translation.en: Is there any cat this size, Ghareeb?
translation.ja: 〈猫にしては大きい〉

translation.en: It's as big as my nose!
translation.ja: 〈鼻も大きい〉

translation.en: Oh, my days!
translation.ja: 〈すごいな〉

translation.en: Flip it over.
translation.ja: 〈ひっくり返す〉

translation.en: Flip it gently.
translation.ja: 〈ゆっくり〉

translation.en: Hello!
translation.ja: 〈やあ！〉

translation.en: -Look! -[Ghareeb speaking Arabic]
translation.ja: 〈見ろ〉

translation.en: [Hamada] The mouth, it's drawn!
translation.ja: 〈口が描かれてる〉

translation.en: And the eyes and nose…
translation.ja: 〈目や鼻も…〉

translation.en: and the ears too.
translation.ja: 〈耳もだ〉

translation.en: Masterpiece!
translation.ja: 〈すばらしい！〉

translation.en: Do we have any creature in our country
translation.ja: 〈エジプトで これに似た生き物は―〉

translation.en: remotely like this?
translation.ja: 〈何かいる？〉

translation.en: [Ghareeb] Nope.
translation.ja: 〈いや〉

translation.en: [Hamada] If you had a cat this big, what would you do with it?
translation.ja: 〈こんな大きな猫が いたら？〉

translation.en: -[Ghareeb] I'd scare the kids with it! -[Hamada laughs]
translation.ja: 〈子供に見せて驚かす〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Could this be a cat?
translation.ja: 〈これは猫か？〉

translation.en: -Where will we put all these, Ghareeb? -[Ghareeb] I don't know.
translation.ja: 〈これらをどこに置く？〉 〈さあな〉

translation.en: -And they're all cats? -[Hamada] No, no, no.
translation.ja: 〈全部 猫？〉 〈いや 違うな〉

translation.en: Praise God, man.
translation.ja: 〈これを見ろ〉

translation.en: This is not a cat.
translation.ja: 〈猫じゃない〉

translation.en: [Ghareeb] Is it a mongoose?
translation.ja: 〈マングース？〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Look at its tail! Its shape, Ghareeb.
translation.ja: 〈この尻尾を見ろ〉

translation.en: This is a crocodile, boss.
translation.ja: 〈これはワニだ〉

translation.en: -Take this… -[Ghareeb] Hmm. -[Hamada] …and put it aside. -[Ghareeb] Sure.
translation.ja: 〈これは 別にしておいてくれ〉

translation.en: [Hamada] This is something else.
translation.ja: 〈別の生き物だから〉

translation.en: This is a crocodile mummy, boss.
translation.ja: 〈ワニのミイラだ〉

translation.en: I think we're done, Ghareeb.
translation.ja: 〈とりあえず終了だ〉

translation.en: We're going to take them out and get ourselves some fresh air.
translation.ja: 〈ミイラを上へ運び 外の空気を吸おう〉

translation.en: [Ghareeb] Send us a crate on two hooks!
translation.ja: 〈箱を下ろしてくれ〉

translation.en: I want to tell you something. Since I started working in this cat necropolis…
translation.ja: 〈この猫の墓地で 作業し始めてから―〉

translation.en: …when cats see me around my house, they run.
translation.ja: 〈猫が僕を見ると 逃げるんだ〉

translation.en: They're afraid of me! They don't act like pets towards me like they used to. [laughs]
translation.ja: 〈怖がって 近づいてきてくれない〉

translation.en: But when a cat runs, I say to her, "Well, you have the right.
translation.ja: 〈でも怖がるのも 無理はない〉

translation.en: I just took your ancestors out of the ground…
translation.ja: 〈彼らの先祖を 地中から出し―〉

translation.en: and put them in storage."
translation.ja: 〈倉庫に入れた〉

translation.en: She's scared I'll do the same thing to her!
translation.ja: 〈同じことをされると おびえてる〉

translation.en: [in English] As far as we know, people didn't give their pet cat as offerings.
translation.ja: 古代の人はペットの猫を 捧げ物にはしなかった

translation.en: [Salima] The ones that they gave as offerings were actually bought from the priests.
translation.ja: 捧げたのは聖職者から 買った猫たちだった

translation.en: [in Arabic] Ah, this one is lovely.
translation.ja: 〈かわいいわね〉

translation.en: [in English] So this is a very nice Bubasteion special.
translation.ja: ブバステイオンで一番だわ

translation.en: So, we think that the priests would be breeding them,
translation.ja: 聖職者たちが猫を繁殖させ―

translation.en: and they'd probably subcontract it out to villagers all around the area of Saqqara,
translation.ja: サッカラ周辺の村人たちに 預けてたんだと思う

translation.en: where people were farming these cats and probably having kitten farms as well.
translation.ja: 村人たちは猫たちを家畜にし 飼育したのね

translation.en: The way a sacred animal cult worked
translation.ja: 神聖な動物は 信仰対象となり―

translation.en: was that there was one animal in the temple,
translation.ja: 神殿には１匹の動物が 祭られた

translation.en: which was supposed to be sort of the divine manifestation of the goddess or the god.
translation.ja: 神や女神の化身として 崇拝されていたのね

translation.en: During its lifetime, this creature would be treated as a god.
translation.ja: その動物は生涯 神として扱われ―

translation.en: Fed, watered, prayed to.
translation.ja: 祈りを捧げられた

translation.en: People would give offerings to this creature.
translation.ja: 餌や水 お供え物もあった

translation.en: -It's a beautiful bronze head! -[man speaking Arabic]
translation.ja: 〈青銅の頭だ〉

translation.en: [Salima] They would give amulets and statues
translation.ja: お守りや像も作られた

translation.en: made of wood, stone, faience, and even bronze.
translation.ja: 木や石 ファイアンスや青銅でね

translation.en: But they also would give animal mummies,
translation.ja: 動物のミイラも捧げられた

translation.en: because, of course, the idea was that if you make a blood sacrifice to the god,
translation.ja: 動物のミイラも捧げられた いけにえは木や石で 作られた物より―

translation.en: that would mean perhaps more than something made out of wood or stone.
translation.ja: 大きな意味を持つと 考えられていたからよ

translation.en: But it's in very good shape for what one would expect after about 2,500 years.
translation.ja: ２千５百年前の物としては かなり状態がいい

translation.en: Where the Bubasteion was built,
translation.ja: ブバステイオン墓地が 作られた時―

translation.en: there were a lot of old tombs that had been cut
translation.ja: ブバステイオン墓地が 作られた時― 辺りには既に 数多くの墓があった

translation.en: in the past 2,000 years of Egyptian history.
translation.ja: 辺りには既に 数多くの墓があった

translation.en: So, the priests would take them into these old tombs -and bury them in mass graves… -[men speaking Arabic]
translation.ja: 聖職者たちは古い墓を 動物の共同墓地として再利用

translation.en: [Salima] …which is what we're finding.
translation.ja: それが今 見つかった

translation.en: -[in Arabic] How's it going? -[man speaking Arabic]
translation.ja: 〈どうだ？〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Like anyone else, I've seen cats of many sizes.
translation.ja: 〈いろんな大きさの猫を 見たことがあるけど―〉

translation.en: But a cat that's absolutely massive like this? I've never seen that before.
translation.ja: 〈こんな超特大サイズの猫は 見たことがない〉

translation.en: We need to get the bones tested to see what it is.
translation.ja: 〈骨を調べてみないと 何かは分からない〉

translation.en: [Nabil] The evidence
translation.ja: 〈この墓に―〉

translation.en: that this tomb contains a riddle
translation.ja: 〈謎が隠されていることを 裏付ける証拠は―〉

translation.en: is substantial.
translation.ja: 〈十分にある〉

translation.en: -What is this? Fabulous! -[Nermeen] There's something.
translation.ja: 〈あそこに…〉 〈これは何だ？　見てみろ〉

translation.en: Look, Nermeen.
translation.ja: 〈これは何だ？　見てみろ〉

translation.en: There's no other engraving like this.
translation.ja: 〈こんな描写は ここだけだ〉

translation.en: Next to the first false door, there is a scene of an offering table…
translation.ja: 〈１つ目の偽扉の横に 神官がテーブルを挟んで―〉

translation.en: with the owner sitting in front of a beautiful lady.
translation.ja: 〈美しい女性と 向かい合ってる絵があった〉

translation.en: I see a few unusual things.
translation.ja: 〈おかしな点がある〉

translation.en: -This is unusual. -[Nermeen] Right?
translation.ja: 〈全部だよ〉

translation.en: [Nabil] All of it is unusual.
translation.ja: 〈全部おかしい〉

translation.en: Usually, it would be the man and his wife.
translation.ja: 〈普通に考えれば あの男女は夫と妻〉

translation.en: So we expected it would be Wahtye and his wife, Ptah-Weret.
translation.ja: 〈だから最初はワフティーと 妻のウェレト･プタハかと〉

translation.en: But when we read the inscription…
translation.ja: 〈でも碑文には こう書かれてた〉

translation.en: it says, "His wife, Merit-Min."
translation.ja: 〈“彼の妻 メリト･ミーン”〉

translation.en: We were standing there…
translation.ja: 〈私たちは驚いて―〉

translation.en: in astonishment.
translation.ja: 〈立ち尽くした〉

translation.en: Because Merit-Min…
translation.ja: 〈メリト･ミーンは―〉

translation.en: was his mother!
translation.ja: 〈彼の母親だからね〉

translation.en: So we started thinking, -"Did he marry his mother?" -[laughs]
translation.ja: 〈母親と結婚してたのかと 考えたけど―〉

translation.en: Of course that conflicts. It's impossible!
translation.ja: 〈そんなこと ありえない〉

translation.en: [Nabil] The names have been changed.
translation.ja: 〈名前が変えられてる〉

translation.en: -I think they've been tampered with. -He replaced them.
translation.ja: 〈改ざんだよ〉 〈書き換えね〉

translation.en: The names had been scraped off.
translation.ja: 〈名前が削り取られていた〉

translation.en: Anyone who runs their hand along the wall would say,
translation.ja: 〈壁に手を滑らせれば 誰でも分かる〉

translation.en: "No, something was afoot here."
translation.ja: 〈何か変えられてると〉

translation.en: Ooh. It isn't Wahtye.
translation.ja: 〈墓の主が違う〉

translation.en: The entire tomb is Wahtye, Wahtye, Wahtye.
translation.ja: 〈至る所にワフティーと 書かれてるが―〉

translation.en: -Here is something different. -Is he a thief then?
translation.ja: 〈ここだけ違う〉 〈泥棒かしら〉

translation.en: He's a thief!
translation.ja: 〈きっとそうね〉

translation.en: [Nabil] Holy crap.
translation.ja: 〈驚いた〉

translation.en: Is that all? No!
translation.ja: 〈証拠は他にもある〉

translation.en: The main statue itself!
translation.ja: 〈メインの像だ〉

translation.en: Looking at the features of that statue…
translation.ja: 〈特徴を見るかぎり…〉

translation.en: This statue is different. It doesn't look like any other statue…
translation.ja: 〈他の像と違う〉 〈ここにある どの像とも異なる〉

translation.en: -[Nermeen] Hmm. -…in the tomb.
translation.ja: 〈ここにある どの像とも異なる〉

translation.en: [Nabil] Clearly a different person than others in the tomb.
translation.ja: 〈１つの像だけ 違う人物なんだ〉

translation.en: Which makes me even more convinced
translation.ja: 〈それで強く確信した〉

translation.en: that a conspiracy took place here.
translation.ja: 〈陰謀があったと〉

translation.en: I think that Wahtye seized this tomb
translation.ja: 〈ワフティーは この墓を 奪ったんだと思う〉

translation.en: and that it wasn't meant for Wahtye at the beginning.
translation.ja: 〈ここは彼の墓では なかったんだ〉

translation.en: Who is the victim?
translation.ja: 〈元の主は？〉

translation.en: The victim is unknown.
translation.ja: 〈不明だ〉

translation.en: But we have a theory.
translation.ja: 〈推測はできる〉

translation.en: Yeah. We have a bunch of clues.
translation.ja: 〈ヒントはたくさんある〉

translation.en: There is mention of a brother. Wahtye's brother.
translation.ja: 〈ワフティーの兄弟に 言及してる箇所が―〉

translation.en: He's mentioned in the eastern wall.
translation.ja: 〈東側の壁にある〉

translation.en: Wahtye dedicates a song…
translation.ja: 〈ワフティーは 歌を捧げてる〉

translation.en: Why didn't he mention his brother's name?
translation.ja: 〈でも名前はない〉

translation.en: I think the dedication of the song
translation.ja: 〈歌を捧げたのも―〉

translation.en: is to assuage his conscience…
translation.ja: 〈良心をなだめるためよ〉

translation.en: -He feels guilty-- -He's feeling guilty!
translation.ja: 〈罪悪感があった〉

translation.en: -So, this man isn't Wahtye? -No, it isn't Wahtye.
translation.ja: 〈この人は…〉 〈ワフティーじゃない〉

translation.en: But it could be his brother.
translation.ja: 〈彼の兄弟かも〉

translation.en: All of these clues…
translation.ja: 〈これらのことから―〉

translation.en: suggest that Wahtye seized this tomb from his brother.
translation.ja: 〈ワフティーは兄弟の墓を 奪ったと推測される〉

translation.en: So if Wahtye did steal his brother's tomb…
translation.ja: 〈もし彼が墓を 盗んだのなら…〉

translation.en: will he be punished in the other world?
translation.ja: 〈彼は死後 裁かれたのか〉

translation.en: No, I think he had a plan.
translation.ja: 〈多分 計画があったのよ〉

translation.en: On the last wall we recorded in the tomb, which was the southern wall,
translation.ja: 〈我々が最後に解読した 南側の壁に―〉

translation.en: we found a very large text that says…
translation.ja: 〈大きな字で こう書いてた〉

translation.en: So he was placing himself in the ranks of those who judge,
translation.ja: 〈彼は自らが 判事になって―〉

translation.en: so that he can personally absolve himself of this sin.
translation.ja: 〈自分を無罪に するつもりだったのよ〉

translation.en: [Nabil] So it seems he really was convinced
translation.ja: 〈彼は裁きを免れ―〉

translation.en: that he would evade punishment and get to the afterlife.
translation.ja: 〈楽園へ行けると 確信していた〉

translation.en: But there are answers no one could provide but Wahtye himself.
translation.ja: 〈もちろん真相は 分からない〉

translation.en: As for the burial shafts,
translation.ja: 〈埋葬用の竪穴には―〉

translation.en: there may be a discovery that answers all the questions
translation.ja: 〈答えになるようなものが あるかも〉

translation.en: and all the riddles in Wahtye's tomb.
translation.ja: 〈ワフティーの墓の謎を 解く鍵が〉

translation.en: Everybody ready for a surprise?
translation.ja: みんな驚くなよ

translation.en: -[Ahmed clears throat] -Okay.
translation.ja: どうぞ

translation.en: Oh, my God!
translation.ja: すごい！

translation.en: -You have this one. -[Salima, in Arabic] Unbelievable!
translation.ja: こんなものがあった 〈見事ね〉

translation.en: -[gasps] Look at the face! -Unbelievable. My God, look at the face!
translation.ja: 見て！　顔が描かれてる

translation.en: Oh, sweetie pie.
translation.ja: かわいい子

translation.en: Oh, my God.
translation.ja: すごいわ

translation.en: [in English] Huge.
translation.ja: 巨大ね

translation.en: [Hamada] It's big, I can't imagine there was ever a cat this size.
translation.ja: 〈こんなに大きな猫が いたなんて〉

translation.en: [gasps, in English] My God, it's amazing!
translation.ja: 本当に すばらしいわ

translation.en: [Ahmed] This is the biggest cat mummy we have ever found.
translation.ja: 〈今までで一番大きな 猫のミイラね〉

translation.en: [Salima, in Arabic] Ah! I see a mustache.
translation.ja: 〈口ヒゲみたい〉

translation.en: -[Salima laughing] -[Ahmed] Like Hamada!
translation.ja: 〈ハマーダ？〉

translation.en: -Yes, like Hamada! -Like Hamada. [laughs]
translation.ja: 〈そっくり！〉

translation.en: This is really interesting.
translation.ja: 興味深いわ

translation.en: [in Arabic] On the heads of other cat mummies, there might be a scarab up here.
translation.ja: 〈他のミイラの頭には スカラベが描かれてた〉

translation.en: It doesn't look like a scarab. It should.
translation.ja: でも これは違う

translation.en: The other ones have actual scarabs painted on their heads.
translation.ja: 他のはスカラベだったけど―

translation.en: This one, it looks more like a bee or something.
translation.ja: これはハチか何かみたい

translation.en: It's really strange. It's unusual.
translation.ja: すごく珍しいわ

translation.en: [Ahmed] And there is even this section…
translation.ja: 〈そして この部分は…〉

translation.en: [gasps] Hi, baby!
translation.ja: まあ ステキ

translation.en: -…which exposes the fur. -You can see fur!
translation.ja: 〈毛が見えてる〉 〈本当ね！〉

translation.en: -[Ahmed] You see the fur. -[man] What remains of it.
translation.ja: 〈毛が見えるとは…〉

translation.en: [Salima] Okay, okay, okay.
translation.ja: ちょっと待って

translation.en: -[man] Golden yellow, a beautiful color. -[Salima] Golden yellow, oh.
translation.ja: 〈明るい黄色でキレイだ〉

translation.en: It can't be, it can't be.
translation.ja: 〈信じられない〉

translation.en: [in English] Now you will find out.
translation.ja: 正体が分かるわ

translation.en: [in Arabic] All good?
translation.ja: 〈撮れた？〉

translation.en: [Salima] That's the head.
translation.ja: 〈頭部だわ〉

translation.en: [in English] I'm not 100% sure what we're looking at,
translation.ja: これが何か 確信を持って言えない

translation.en: because the head, unfortunately, is finished.
translation.ja: 残念ながら 頭部の損傷が激しい

translation.en: It's really very big.
translation.ja: とても大きいのは分かる

translation.en: Can you zoom in?
translation.ja: 〈拡大して〉

translation.en: So you can see it's a baby…
translation.ja: 〈赤ちゃんのようね〉

translation.en: because these teeth are still mostly up inside the gums.
translation.ja: 〈ここの歯が まだ 歯茎の中に埋もれてる〉

translation.en: Big canines, huh?
translation.ja: 大きな牙ね

translation.en: -Yeah. -They're up…
translation.ja: まだ歯が…

translation.en: The teeth have only just started growing. Okay, go down. Carry on down.
translation.ja: 〈歯が生え始めたところね 下に行って〉

translation.en: The backbone. Look at the backbone.
translation.ja: 〈背骨が見えるね〉

translation.en: [Salima, in English] The backbone. Nothing's fused.
translation.ja: 背骨ね　損傷が全くない

translation.en: This is definitely a baby.
translation.ja: 〈やはり赤ちゃんね〉

translation.en: And it's got an arch in the backbone. [speaks Arabic]
translation.ja: 背骨がアーチ状になってる

translation.en: [in English] So, if it were stretched out properly, it would be more than a meter.
translation.ja: まっすぐ伸ばしたら １メートル以上あると思うわ

translation.en: -Yeah. -Like this, -from head to the base of its tail. -Yeah.
translation.ja: こんなふうに頭から 尻尾の先までね

translation.en: -Now, this is no domestic cat. -[Hamada] Yes.
translation.ja: 土着猫ではない

translation.en: It's too big for a lynx,
translation.ja: オオヤマネコでもない

translation.en: it's not a leopard or a cheetah.
translation.ja: ヒョウやチーターとも違う

translation.en: So maybe the design is different because this is a different species.
translation.ja: 猫じゃないから 絵が違うのかも

translation.en: -[man speaks Arabic] -Yeah. Look at this.
translation.ja: 例えば―

translation.en: Okay, let's just see this.
translation.ja: これを見て

translation.en: -Just an idea. It might be wrong. -Yeah.
translation.ja: まだ確信は持てないけど…

translation.en: -Remember the way the lions frown? -[Hamada] Uh-huh.
translation.ja: ライオンは眉間に シワを寄せる

translation.en: Maybe this is supposed to be like that,
translation.ja: 最初はそれを描いて―

translation.en: and they put the wings on because they're used to having the scarab. -Yes. -[speaking Arabic]
translation.ja: あとから慣習に従って 虫のようにしたのかも

translation.en: [in English] Let's look at a cub. It's this… This is the long nose…
translation.ja: ライオンの子と比べると 鼻が長くて…

translation.en: Yeah, yeah! That's why the nose is so long!
translation.ja: それで鼻が長いのね！

translation.en: -You're sure? -Yes! And the color.
translation.ja: そうかな？ それに色

translation.en: [in Arabic] This is the first time in the known history of mummification
translation.ja: 〈ちゃんとした ライオンのミイラが―〉

translation.en: -that we have a lion here in Saqqara! -A mummified lion!
translation.ja: 〈見つかるのは初めてよ〉

translation.en: [Salima] I hope so!
translation.ja: 〈多分ね〉

translation.en: We think, based on the markings that are painted on the face,
translation.ja: 顔に描かれていた 模様からも―

translation.en: that this is actually maybe a baby lion. It's a lion cub.
translation.ja: これはライオンの子供だと 思われるわ

translation.en: This is just extraordinary,
translation.ja: すごい発見よ

translation.en: because there are stories of lion catacombs,
translation.ja: ライオンの墓地についての ウワサがあって―

translation.en: and some of us have been looking for years and years and years for this.
translation.ja: 何年も何年も 探し続けてきた人たちがいる

translation.en: But now, the logical place is the Bubasteion.
translation.ja: ブバステイオンにあるのかも

translation.en: I mean, it's… it's mind-blowing
translation.ja: このライオンが―

translation.en: to think of what this lion might represent in terms of our understanding
translation.ja: このライオンが― 古代エジプトの文化や経済 宗教について―

translation.en: of ancient Egyptian culture, economy, religion.
translation.ja: 理解を深める役に立つはずよ

translation.en: It also changes how we think
translation.ja: 古代エジプト人が―

translation.en: about how the ancient Egyptians were interacting with wild animals.
translation.ja: どう野生動物に 触れ合っていたのかも分かる

translation.en: How they might have been breeding them or keeping them tame,
translation.ja: どう飼いならしたのかとか―

translation.en: how they might have used them to worship,
translation.ja: どう利用したかとかね

translation.en: but also, in the same way as with some of the other animals,
translation.ja: 他の動物と同じように―

translation.en: they were breeding them and they were then giving them as offerings.
translation.ja: 育てて いけにえにした 可能性もある

translation.en: It's… It's just… so exciting.
translation.ja: とにかく興奮するわ

translation.en: I will tell Ghareeb, uh, "It's a… It's a baby lion, not a cat, Ghareeb!"
translation.ja: ガリーブにライオンだったと 教えてやろう

translation.en: [in Arabic] There will definitely be a reward for the team.
translation.ja: 〈チームに ご褒美もあるはず〉

translation.en: [in Arabic] This area was coming down, so we've stabilized it.
translation.ja: 〈ここが落ちそうだったから 補強した〉

translation.en: That's great. Brilliant.
translation.ja: 〈いいね　すばらしい〉

translation.en: Yeah. We've been waiting so long, we just want to get on with it.
translation.ja: 〈発掘調査を始めたくて ずっと待ってた〉

translation.en: [man] You can start then.
translation.ja: 〈始められるね〉

translation.en: Since the first day we entered the tomb…
translation.ja: 〈初めて墓に 入った日から―〉

translation.en: [Hamada] …I'd been staring at the sand in the shafts.
translation.ja: 〈竪穴が気になってる〉

translation.en: [man] Give word to the workers.
translation.ja: 〈作業員に指示を〉

translation.en: Wondering what we'll find down there. Wahtye, his secrets, his riddles,
translation.ja: 〈その下に 何が眠っているのか？〉

translation.en: are they finished?
translation.ja: 〈謎が明かされるのか？〉

translation.en: I come in daily hoping, "Please let us work inside Wahtye today."
translation.ja: 〈早く作業を始めたくて―〉

translation.en: I was going to lose my mind!
translation.ja: 〈毎日 祈ってた〉

translation.en: [Mustafa] Listen up, men!
translation.ja: 〈聞いてくれ〉

translation.en: [men] Yes, Foreman!
translation.ja: 〈はい 親方〉

translation.en: [Mustafa] We're ready to start working in the tomb.
translation.ja: 〈墓の作業を開始する〉

translation.en: The restoration is complete and it's all been secured for you.
translation.ja: 〈修復が終わり 安全になった〉

translation.en: We need hard work and tough men!
translation.ja: 〈全力で作業するぞ〉

translation.en: -[men speaking Arabic] -[Mustafa] Do you understand?
translation.ja: 〈いいか？〉

translation.en: -Then let's go! -[men speaking Arabic]
translation.ja: 〈行こう〉

translation.en: [Salima] Finding the original occupants of an old kingdom tomb nowadays would be fantastic.
translation.ja: 古代の墓の最初の主を 現代なら割り出せる

translation.en: But it hasn't happened for the last 60 years, 70 years.
translation.ja: ここ60～70年は そういう事例がなかった

translation.en: And now, with our greater technological abilities,
translation.ja: 今なら高い技術がある

translation.en: it's the bodies themselves, the bio-archaeology you can carry out.
translation.ja: 生物考古学を駆使して ミイラを鑑定するの

translation.en: -[Mustafa speaking Arabic] -[Salima] Understanding the skeletons,
translation.ja: 骨を見れば―

translation.en: being able to see what kind of diseases, or not, they had.
translation.ja: かかっていた病気も 割り出せる

translation.en: Trying to find relationships, if it's a whole family.
translation.ja: 家族関係も分かるわ

translation.en: [in Arabic] Put those down here.
translation.ja: 〈そこに置け〉

translation.en: It would be a real treasure trove.
translation.ja: これこそが本当の宝の山よ

translation.en: We'll start with this shaft and the one Ghareeb is standing in.
translation.ja: 〈ガリーブの下の穴から 始める〉

translation.en: In the name of Allah and may God bless us.
translation.ja: 〈我々にアラーの祝福あれ〉

translation.en: We need information, not object.
translation.ja: 〈物より情報が欲しい〉

translation.en: -[Mustafa speaking Arabic] -[Mohammad] Make a chain. You stay here.
translation.ja: 〈列を作って砂を手渡しで 外へ出せ〉

translation.en: [Mustafa] Carry it over your shoulder and take it outside.
translation.ja: 〈担いで運び出せばいい〉

translation.en: We have statues, beautiful walls. It's enough.
translation.ja: 像も壁画も十分見つかった

translation.en: But we need more information about him…
translation.ja: 碑文の謎を解き明かすため―

translation.en: [Ahmed, in English] …to solve some mysteries written in his wall.
translation.ja: もっと墓の主の情報が欲しい

translation.en: [in English] To understand what happened in his life.
translation.ja: 彼に何があったのか知りたい

translation.en: [Mustafa] Pick up any shards.
translation.ja: 〈破片を拾え〉

translation.en: [Mustafa] Any fragments, pick them up, Ghareeb.
translation.ja: 〈あらゆる破片を拾え〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] Sometimes, when workmen working…
translation.ja: 作業員たちを見てると…

translation.en: you feel that you go back many centuries during the time of ancient Egypt.
translation.ja: 古代エジプトにいるような 感覚に陥る時がある

translation.en: You work with the same materials which the ancient Egyptians used.
translation.ja: 古代エジプト人と 同じ道具を使ってる

translation.en: Sometimes, we discover the same baskets used by ancient Egyptians.
translation.ja: 今も使われるようなカゴが 見つかったりもする

translation.en: Sometimes we discover a chisel…
translation.ja: 同じようなノミがあったり

translation.en: like a small chisel which we use until now.
translation.ja: 今も使われる小型のノミだ

translation.en: So it's continuation. Life goes in the same direction.
translation.ja: そうやって文化は 受け継がれていく

translation.en: -[Osama] Mr. Ahmed! -[Ahmed] Yes, Osama?
translation.ja: 〈アハメド〉

translation.en: -[Osama] There's something here. -[Ahmed] What is it?
translation.ja: 〈何かある〉 〈何だ？〉

translation.en: Oh, yes! It looks like a wooden coffin.
translation.ja: 〈ああ 本当だ〉 〈木棺に見える〉

translation.en: -The head is pointing… to the west. -[Osama speaking Arabic]
translation.ja: 〈頭は東を向いてる〉

translation.en: [Osama] Let's just expose the feet and move this way as we go.
translation.ja: 〈足のほうから徐々に 砂を払っていこう〉

translation.en: [Ahmed] Osama, you have to be very careful here.
translation.ja: 〈ウサマ　ここ気をつけて〉

translation.en: [Osama] Something beautiful. A wonderful coffin!
translation.ja: 〈とても美しい棺(ひつぎ)だ〉

translation.en: This is the best coffin we've found in this condition.
translation.ja: 〈保存状態もすばらしい〉

translation.en: [in English] As a part of my job, Secretary General,
translation.ja: 事務局長という立場なので―

translation.en: it means that I have to stop by most of the sites in Egypt.
translation.ja: たくさんのエジプトの遺跡に 足を運ぶ

translation.en: [in English] This mission, it's very important science.
translation.ja: サッカラの発掘は 重要な任務だ

translation.en: [Waziri, in English] Opening a coffin… What's in there?
translation.ja: 棺の中には何があるのか？

translation.en: [Waziri, in English] Sometimes, we find a wooden coffin with a mummy
translation.ja: 保存状態の完璧なミイラが―

translation.en: in perfect condition of preservation.
translation.ja: 入ってる時もある

translation.en: [Waziri] Sometimes, we found nothing.
translation.ja: 空っぽの時もある

translation.en: Maybe the ancient Egyptians made the coffin, but there's nothing in there.
translation.ja: 古代エジプト人が 棺だけ作ったのかも

translation.en: So, nobody can be sure what's in there.
translation.ja: 中に何があるか誰も知らない

translation.en: [Waziri, in Arabic] Slowly, slowly.
translation.ja: 〈ゆっくりな〉

translation.en: Mummification is about trying to preserve your image as yourself.
translation.ja: ミイラは生前の姿を 保つため作られた

translation.en: [Waziri] What's happened here, Ashraf?
translation.ja: 〈ここは？〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] It looks like it's burnt.
translation.ja: 〈焦げて見える〉

translation.en: What the Egyptians would do is stick something up your nose,
translation.ja: 作り方は死者の鼻に 何かを差し込み―

translation.en: break through your bone up here to access your brain, pull it out,
translation.ja: 奥の骨を突き破って 脳をかき出した

translation.en: and then they would make a cut on the left side and take out your internal organs.
translation.ja: そして左脇腹を切って 内臓を取り出す

translation.en: They'd take out your liver, your lungs, your stomach, and your intestines.
translation.ja: 肝臓 肺 胃 そして腸をね

translation.en: So, after all of these internal organs have been removed,
translation.ja: そうした臓器を 取り出したら―

translation.en: you'd be dried using natron, which is this combination of baking soda and salt.
translation.ja: 重曹と塩を混ぜた ナトロンを使って遺体を乾燥

translation.en: [Sabry, in Arabic] Why would it look burnt?
translation.ja: 〈なぜ焦げて見える？〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] It could be the natron used in mummification that caused that.
translation.ja: 〈ミイラを作る時に使う ナトロンが原因かと〉

translation.en: [Sabry] So some sort of…
translation.ja: 〈つまり何らかの―〉

translation.en: -chemical reaction has occurred? -[man speaking Arabic]
translation.ja: 〈化学反応が起きたと？〉

translation.en: [Salima] And then, they would start to wrap you using linen bandages…
translation.ja: そしてリネンで遺体を巻くの

translation.en: -A female, I think. -[Mohammad] A female.
translation.ja: 〈女性のようだ〉

translation.en: [Salima, in English] …and reciting spells and praying and burning incense.
translation.ja: 呪文を唱え 祈りを捧げ 香をたいた

translation.en: The bottom half isn't as badly affected, but it's good linen.
translation.ja: 〈下半身は それほど ひどくない〉

translation.en: [in English] And all of this, what it did was transform you from a secular creature
translation.ja: こうすることによって 死者は生身の人間から―

translation.en: to a sacred being.
translation.ja: 神聖な存在に

translation.en: That would be the end of it for your life on earth.
translation.ja: 現世での暮らしは終わり

translation.en: [Salima] It would be the start of your life in the afterworld.
translation.ja: でも死後の世界が待っている

translation.en: [Hamada] Mummifying the body is said to have been influenced by the story of Osiris and Isis…
translation.ja: 〈オシリスとイシスの神話が ミイラ作りの由来とされる〉

translation.en: which had a profound effect on the way the ancient Egyptians treated their dead.
translation.ja: 〈古代エジプト人の死生観に 重大な影響を与えた神話だ〉

translation.en: Isis and Osiris were brother and sister.
translation.ja: 〈オシリスとイシスは兄妹〉

translation.en: Osiris was ruling the world
translation.ja: 〈オシリスは王だったが―〉

translation.en: -until his brother Seth murdered him… -[groaning]
translation.ja: 〈弟のセトに殺され―〉

translation.en: …and cut him into pieces that were spread across the lands of Egypt.
translation.ja: 〈遺体を切断され エジプト中に まかれた〉

translation.en: Isis was a magician. She went around Egypt collecting his pieces,
translation.ja: 〈魔術を使うイシスは 遺体の破片を回収し―〉

translation.en: binding them together with linen in the first act of mummification.
translation.ja: 〈リネンを巻いて結合させ ミイラにした〉

translation.en: Through this, she brought him back to life
translation.ja: 〈その過程でイシスは オシリスを復活させた〉

translation.en: and had their son Horus.
translation.ja: 〈そして息子ホルスを産む〉

translation.en: Horus grew up to avenge his father's murder
translation.ja: 〈成長したホルスは 父のかたきを討ち―〉

translation.en: and rule Egypt as king of life on Earth.
translation.ja: 〈地上の王として君臨した〉

translation.en: Osiris became king of the underworld
translation.ja: 〈オシリスは 冥界の王となり―〉

translation.en: and the god of death and resurrection.
translation.ja: 〈死と復活の神となった〉

translation.en: That conviction in the power of mummification to transcend death…
translation.ja: 〈ミイラ化によって再生する という考えは―〉

translation.en: was right at the heart of ancient Egyptian belief.
translation.ja: 〈古代エジプト人の 信仰の中心にあった〉

translation.en: [Mustafa] Get Dr. Mohammad and tell him the foreman needs him.
translation.ja: 〈ムハンマド博士を 呼んでくれ〉

translation.en: [man] Mr. Ahmed!
translation.ja: 〈アハメド〉

translation.en: [Ahmed, in English] They reached the floor of the shaft.
translation.ja: 竪穴の底に達してしまった

translation.en: So, this is very bad news.
translation.ja: これは うれしくない

translation.en: [in English] I don't know why. 'Cause the shaft is big,
translation.ja: 大きな竪穴なのに なぜかな

translation.en: like one meter by one meter.
translation.ja: １メートル四方だ

translation.en: Usually, these shafts with these measurements go deeper,
translation.ja: 通常 このくらいの竪穴は―

translation.en: like six or seven meters with the room down.
translation.ja: ６～７メートルの深さがある

translation.en: But, unfortunately, this one finished quickly.
translation.ja: でも残念ながら この竪穴は とても浅かった

translation.en: We don't know why. And they also…. They found some…
translation.ja: 竪穴の中には こんな物があった

translation.en: what remains of… of fragments of pottery.
translation.ja: 陶器のかけらのようだ

translation.en: -This came from down there? -[Mustafa] Yes.
translation.ja: 〈これだけ？〉 〈ああ〉

translation.en: -[Ahmed] These bones too? -[Mustafa] Yeah, the loose bone too.
translation.ja: 〈骨も？〉 〈陶器とは別にね〉

translation.en: [Ahmed, in English] So they follow it here in the shaft. This… bad signs.
translation.ja: 竪穴を掘ってみたんだが このとおり

translation.en: [Ahmed, in Arabic] Boss, this is very disappointing.
translation.ja: 〈期待外れだった〉

translation.en: The shaft has bottomed out already.
translation.ja: 〈もうここが底だ〉

translation.en: Only 60 centimeters deep. -[Mustafa] Hmm. -[Ahmed] That's it.
translation.ja: 〈深さ60センチって とこだろう〉

translation.en: I am Ghareeb Ali Mohammed Abushousha.
translation.ja: 〈俺の名前はガリーブ〉

translation.en: I work as a digger.
translation.ja: 〈発掘作業員をしてる〉

translation.en: I've been working here since long ago. My father worked here before me.
translation.ja: 〈長年ここで働いてる 父もここで働いてた〉

translation.en: Thirty or forty… maybe fifty years ago.
translation.ja: 〈30年… いや 50年ぐらい前かな〉

translation.en: When I'm working, all my thoughts are about what's in front of me.
translation.ja: 〈作業してる時は 目の前のことに集中してる〉

translation.en: It's not just mindless digging, no.
translation.ja: 〈何も考えずに 掘ってるわけじゃない〉

translation.en: When you're holding the mattock, you have to have some sense.
translation.ja: 〈つるはしを持ってる時は 頭を働かせないとな〉

translation.en: Are you going to find something? You have to be prepared.
translation.ja: 〈心構えを しておく必要がある〉

translation.en: You could come across a mummy, a bone, a fragment of something.
translation.ja: 〈ミイラや骨 何かの破片を 見つけるかもしれない〉

translation.en: You have to be ready for that.
translation.ja: 〈注意してないと〉

translation.en: A novice will end up breaking the thing.
translation.ja: 〈新米なら何か壊すかも〉

translation.en: Mahmoud!
translation.ja: 〈マハムド〉

translation.en: -[men speaking Arabic] -Mahmoud, come here!
translation.ja: 〈こっちへ来い〉

translation.en: Sit down here, Mahmoud, sit here.
translation.ja: 〈ここに座れ〉

translation.en: Sit beside me. Have some tea.
translation.ja: 〈ほら 紅茶だ〉

translation.en: This is Mahmoud, my son.
translation.ja: 〈俺の息子だ〉

translation.en: I brought him here to learn the ropes.
translation.ja: 〈仕事を教えるために 連れてきた〉

translation.en: So when the foreman needs him to work, he'll have experience.
translation.ja: 〈必要とされたら すぐ働けるようにね〉

translation.en: If he stayed at home, he'd learn nothing.
translation.ja: 〈家にいても 何も学ぶことはない〉

translation.en: Then I wouldn't be happy.
translation.ja: 〈それじゃ困るんだ〉

translation.en: My happiness is having him here with me.
translation.ja: 〈息子がそばにいると うれしい〉

translation.en: [Hamada] What can you see?
translation.ja: 〈何が見える？〉

translation.en: [Ghareeb] There's a wall here, I think, a mudbrick wall.
translation.ja: 〈日干しレンガの壁が あるようだ〉

translation.en: [Hamada] On which side?
translation.ja: 〈方角は？〉

translation.en: -[Ghareeb] Eastern side. -[Hamada] The eastern side?
translation.ja: 〈東側だ〉 〈東？〉

translation.en: Isn't it a bit strange, east?
translation.ja: 〈それは変だ〉

translation.en: [Ahmed] It should be west.
translation.ja: 〈西でなきゃ〉

translation.en: -[Hamada] Are you joking, Ghareeb? -[Ghareeb] I'm serious.
translation.ja: 〈冗談か ガリーブ〉 〈いや 本当だ〉

translation.en: Be careful, his eyesight is bad and it worries me.
translation.ja: 〈目が悪くなってるのかも〉

translation.en: -[Ahmed chuckles] -I don't trust him!
translation.ja: 〈信じないぞ！〉

translation.en: Be careful, watch out.
translation.ja: 〈気をつけて〉

translation.en: If it turns out you're winding me up, Ghareeb…
translation.ja: 〈期待させるな ガリーブ〉

translation.en: -It's all good. -[man speaking Arabic]
translation.ja: 〈大丈夫かな〉

translation.en: -[Hamada] Unbelievable! -[Ghareeb] Mm.
translation.ja: 〈驚いた〉

translation.en: -[Hamada] It is a wall. -[Ghareeb] Mm.
translation.ja: 〈本当に壁がある〉

translation.en: It reminds me of the wall blocking Wahtye's tomb.
translation.ja: 〈この墓の外の壁に似てる〉

translation.en: [Ghareeb] Turns out what I said was true?
translation.ja: 〈言ったとおりだろ？〉

translation.en: Yes, and I have a big reward for you!
translation.ja: 〈ああ 褒美をあげよう〉

translation.en: [Ghareeb] Fine.
translation.ja: 〈どうも〉

translation.en: -There is something wooden. -[Ahmed] What?
translation.ja: 〈木の何かがある〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Something wooden has started to appear.
translation.ja: 〈何かが見え始めた〉

translation.en: About three centimeters of something wood.
translation.ja: 〈３センチぐらいだが〉

translation.en: [Hamada] What I can see now is…
translation.ja: 〈今 見えてるのは―〉

translation.en: there's a lid.
translation.ja: 〈フタだ〉

translation.en: -It's a great feeling… -[man speaks Arabic]
translation.ja: 〈いい気分だ〉 〈４千年前の物の 封印を解いてくのはね〉

translation.en: [Hamada] …taking apart something from more than 4,000 years ago.
translation.ja: 〈４千年前の物の 封印を解いてくのはね〉

translation.en: The first hand to touch it after the ancient Egyptian who sealed it.
translation.ja: 〈古代の人が閉じてから 初めて触れられる〉

translation.en: For that to be your hand is something phenomenal.
translation.ja: 〈それが自分だなんて〉

translation.en: It's strange how well-sealed it is!
translation.ja: 〈密閉されてる〉

translation.en: The person who sealed it is saying, "Nobody come near it, nobody even get close to it."
translation.ja: 〈まるで“誰も近づくな”と 言っているようだ〉

translation.en: -[men speaking Arabic] -[Mohammad] Peace be upon you!
translation.ja: 〈こんにちは〉

translation.en: -[Ahmed] How's it going? -[Mohammad] All good. Thank God.
translation.ja: 〈作業はどうだ？〉 〈ああ 順調だ〉

translation.en: [Ahmed] Hamada is performing a heroic deed.
translation.ja: 〈ハマーダが頑張ってる〉

translation.en: [Hamada] This space is tight and hot and really terrible!
translation.ja: 〈ここは狭くて暑くて 最悪だ〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] But you're the first hand to open the blockage, Hamada!
translation.ja: 〈でも最初に 開けられるんだぞ〉

translation.en: [Hamada] It's my only consolation.
translation.ja: 〈それだけが救いだ〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] Take a look, Hamada. What is that?
translation.ja: 〈ハマーダ それは？〉

translation.en: Is that mud or what?
translation.ja: 〈泥か何か？〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Yeah, mud.
translation.ja: 〈泥だ〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] Because of the water.
translation.ja: 〈水が原因だ〉

translation.en: When rain seeped through the ceiling cracks,
translation.ja: 〈土を含んだ雨水が―〉

translation.en: it brought dirt with it, which will have filled up the coffin too.
translation.ja: 〈天井から流れ込み 棺を満たしたんだ〉

translation.en: So it'll be impossible to get it out in one piece.
translation.ja: 〈崩さずに取り出すのは 不可能だ〉

translation.en: [Ahmed] No, it'll come out intact.
translation.ja: 〈無傷ではな〉

translation.en: That's impossible! Get that block on the left first.
translation.ja: 〈とりあえず 左側を取り除け〉

translation.en: -[Ahmed] That one? -[Mohammad] To make room.
translation.ja: 〈ここ？〉 〈スペースを作れ〉

translation.en: Yes, yes.
translation.ja: 〈その調子だ〉

translation.en: I told you not to touch that.
translation.ja: 〈触れるなと言ったのに〉

translation.en: [Hamada] I didn't touch anything. I didn't even come close!
translation.ja: 〈違う　当たってない〉

translation.en: Look, in front of him, it's like a concrete wall.
translation.ja: 〈中はコンクリートの 壁みたいだろ〉

translation.en: It was compressed after it filled in the space.
translation.ja: 〈流れ込んだ泥が 圧縮された〉

translation.en: -[Hamada] It's solid, boss. -[speaks Arabic]
translation.ja: 〈固まってる〉

translation.en: The coffin is full of mud and it's packed tight.
translation.ja: 〈棺の中は泥でいっぱいだ〉

translation.en: -And there's a skeleton inside! -[Mohammad] Thank God!
translation.ja: 〈中に骸骨がある〉 〈よかった〉

translation.en: [Hamada] I'll collect the bones.
translation.ja: 〈骨を集める〉

translation.en: Unbelievable…
translation.ja: 〈まったく…〉

translation.en: We've been waiting a long time to know anything about him.
translation.ja: 〈主について 何か分かると思ったのに〉

translation.en: Pass the wood up.
translation.ja: 〈木片をくれ〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] Look, only 32 centimeters.
translation.ja: 〈32センチしかない〉

translation.en: It must be for a young child.
translation.ja: 〈きっと子供の棺だ〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Hey, Doctor!
translation.ja: 〈博士〉

translation.en: -[Hamada] Check this out. -[Mohammad] A molar.
translation.ja: 〈見てくれ〉 〈大臼歯だ〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Working at the site,
translation.ja: 〈作業現場は―〉

translation.en: it's a naturally morbid place.
translation.ja: 〈墓だから当然 陰気な場所だ〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] They're teeth.
translation.ja: 〈歯だね〉

translation.en: -[Hamada] You're in the world of the dead. -[Mohammad] It's even rotten.
translation.ja: 〈死者の眠る場所だからね〉 〈腐ってる〉

translation.en: [Hamada] Child burials in particular.
translation.ja: 〈特に子供の墓で―〉

translation.en: I mean, my heart breaks when I see the remains of a child.
translation.ja: 〈子供の遺体を見ると 心が痛む〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] These teeth have come from the mummy down there.
translation.ja: 〈これらの歯は そのミイラのものだ〉

translation.en: -They're molars, but they're very small. -[Mustafa] How old?
translation.ja: 〈大臼歯が すごく小さい〉 〈推定年齢は？〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] More like 14, 15… something like that.
translation.ja: 〈14か15歳ぐらいだ〉

translation.en: We thought that it is a child.
translation.ja: 子供だと分かったが―

translation.en: But not just one. It is more than one child.
translation.ja: まさか１人以上とは 思わなかった

translation.en: We collect all these bones,
translation.ja: 骨を集めて―

translation.en: and we ask our anthropologist who comes and investigates these bones for us.
translation.ja: 人類学者に頼んで 見てもらった

translation.en: [Amira] Every piece of bone can tell you something.
translation.ja: アミーラ 骨は いろいろ教えてくれる アミーラ

translation.en: Not only the way of death.
translation.ja: 死因だけじゃない

translation.en: The more interesting stories are about their lives.
translation.ja: どんなふうに 生きていたかを―

translation.en: How did they live?
translation.ja: 語ってくれる

translation.en: That's five… [speaks indistinctly]
translation.ja: これで５個

translation.en: Was he healthy? Was he happy?
translation.ja: 健康だったか　幸せだったか

translation.en: Was he sad?
translation.ja: 悲しんでいたか

translation.en: It can be known, just on the bones.
translation.ja: 骨だけが知ってることよ

translation.en: My name is Amira Shaheen. I'm a professor of rheumatology
translation.ja: 私はアミーラ･シャヒーン リウマチ学の教授よ

translation.en: in Faculty of Medicine, Cairo University.
translation.ja: カイロ大学医学部で教えてる

translation.en: And I work here to examine the bones
translation.ja: 今は骨の分析をしてる

translation.en: which are found in the different expeditions.
translation.ja: 発掘調査で見つかったものよ

translation.en: I'm going to spread this one, and then I'm going to study their pieces.
translation.ja: 見つかった骨を広げて 観察していくわ

translation.en: When Dr. Sabry asked me to come,
translation.ja: サブリ博士に依頼された時―

translation.en: he told me there are small bones for children. How many, we don't know. That's it.
translation.ja: 教えられたのは“子供の骨で 何人分かは分からない”だけ

translation.en: It's important we find, um, the number of persons,
translation.ja: 何人埋葬されていたか―

translation.en: and we want to know the common traits or the different features of the bones.
translation.ja: 骨に共通点や 異なる特徴があるか見ていく

translation.en: First of all, I say, "As-salamu alaykum."
translation.ja: まず“こんにちは”と あいさつを

translation.en: I feel that I'm coming, introducing myself to someone who is sitting in front of me.
translation.ja: 自分の前に誰かがいる気分で 自己紹介する

translation.en: Even if he is, or she is, in pieces.
translation.ja: 例え その人がバラバラでも

translation.en: These small pieces, this is, um…
translation.ja: この小さな骨は きっと…

translation.en: It's the same way that I approach a… a friend.
translation.ja: 友達になる時みたいにね

translation.en: This is the right humerus, so I should put it here.
translation.ja: これは右上腕骨だから ここね

translation.en: I don't know how to get feelings from bones, but I can feel it. You can feel it.
translation.ja: なぜだか知らないけど 骨から感情が伝わってくる

translation.en: And this is the right clavicle of one of them.
translation.ja: これは１人の子の右鎖骨

translation.en: The shaft nearest the door had the bones of two teenage children.
translation.ja: 入り口に一番近い竪穴には ２人の十代の子供の骨が

translation.en: We have this sacrum, and the other one which is large,
translation.ja: 仙骨は１人の子のほうが 大きい

translation.en: and both are still not un-united, not… [speaks indistinctly]
translation.ja: どちらも まだ癒合してないわ

translation.en: One of them was younger than 20,
translation.ja: １人は20歳未満で―

translation.en: and the other one was… most were younger than 18.
translation.ja: もう１人は18歳未満よ

translation.en: By comparing the size of bones,
translation.ja: 骨の大きさから―

translation.en: I think these bones are the… the one with… [inhales sharply] 18 to 20.
translation.ja: こっちが 18～20歳の子の骨で―

translation.en: Yes, and this… this is the younger one.
translation.ja: こっちが もっと若いほう

translation.en: And there were pieces of bone,
translation.ja: 他にも もう１人―

translation.en: most probably related to a younger person, maybe below six years old.
translation.ja: もっと幼い ６歳未満の子の骨もあった

translation.en: Cervical…
translation.ja: けい部…

translation.en: On the first one.
translation.ja: １人目の子ね

translation.en: I find in one box, which contains three skeletons,
translation.ja: １つの棺に３人分の骨が 入っていた

translation.en: we have a strange situation of this family,
translation.ja: この家族には 何かあったようね

translation.en: with the death of three of their children at the same time.
translation.ja: ３人の子供が 同時に亡くなるなんて

translation.en: [in English] What happened here?
translation.ja: いったい何が？

translation.en: [Mohammad, in English] According to the reliefs in the tomb,
translation.ja: 墓のレリーフによると―

translation.en: we have Wahtye, and his mother, and his wife, and his four children.
translation.ja: ワフティーには母親と 妻と４人の子がいた

translation.en: We have, now, three children.
translation.ja: 今回見つかったのは３人

translation.en: So we start to search for the other part from the family.
translation.ja: それ以外の者たちを 探すことにした

translation.en: [in Arabic] All right, obviously, this shaft is done.
translation.ja: 〈この竪穴には もう何もない〉

translation.en: Now it'll be easier for the workers to work over here.
translation.ja: 〈こっちの穴は 作業しやすいぞ〉

translation.en: Come on, Hashem, we're going to work in this shaft.
translation.ja: 〈ハシェム これに取りかかろう〉

translation.en: [Ahmed] What have you found?
translation.ja: 〈何があった？〉

translation.en: Beautiful, beautiful.
translation.ja: 〈すばらしい〉

translation.en: What's this beauty?
translation.ja: 〈これは？〉

translation.en: [in English] It's a complete burial, um, late, late period, like 600 BC.
translation.ja: 末期王朝時代の 紀元前600年ごろの墓だ

translation.en: More than 2,600 years old.
translation.ja: ２千６百年以上前だね

translation.en: The bones, it's, um… collapsed, as you see.
translation.ja: 見てのとおり 骨は崩れてるが―

translation.en: It still has the equipment for the afterlife.
translation.ja: 副葬品まで ちゃんと残ってる

translation.en: [Mustafa] The box, Mr. Ahmed?
translation.ja: 〈箱がある〉

translation.en: [Ahmed] Yes, a very beautiful box, Foreman Mustafa.
translation.ja: 〈すごくキレイな箱だね〉

translation.en: [Mustafa] A unique piece, Mr. Ahmed.
translation.ja: 〈こんな物は珍しい〉

translation.en: -[blows] -[Mustafa] Is it a game, Mr. Ahmed?
translation.ja: 〈ボードゲームかな〉

translation.en: [Ahmed] Yeah, Senet. It's a bit like chess.
translation.ja: 〈ああ セネトだ チェスに似てる〉

translation.en: [Mustafa] Wow. These people were so cool to play chess.
translation.ja: 〈チェスをやってたとは〉

translation.en: Look what's inside.
translation.ja: 〈中を見てみよう〉

translation.en: [Mustafa] This is bone.
translation.ja: 〈骨だ〉

translation.en: [Ahmed] Must've had a function in the game.
translation.ja: 〈ゲームの道具だろう〉

translation.en: [Mustafa] We can arrange them like this and play,
translation.ja: 〈このまま使えるよ〉

translation.en: -you and I, Mr. Ahmed. -[Ahmed laughs]
translation.ja: 〈勝負だ〉

translation.en: [in English] This is, um, something to play, like chess in our life today.
translation.ja: これは現代のチェスに似た ボードゲームだ

translation.en: In ancient times, it's called Senet.
translation.ja: 古代の名前はセネト

translation.en: I don't know exactly how they can play.
translation.ja: どう遊んでいたかは不明だ

translation.en: I don't understand, because here, we have like, uh, 20 places.
translation.ja: これは20マスしかないが― 30マスあるものもある

translation.en: And that one has 30.
translation.ja: 30マスあるものもある

translation.en: I don't know the function of it, how they can play.
translation.ja: 遊び方が全く分からない

translation.en: -…19. -[Ahmed] These are bones.
translation.ja: 〈それらは骨だね〉

translation.en: [Mustafa] They look like vertebrae.
translation.ja: 〈けい椎のようだ〉 〈それをどこに置くんだ〉

translation.en: -[Ahmed] Where do the bones go? -[Mustafa] I don't know.
translation.ja: 〈それをどこに置くんだ〉 〈分からない〉

translation.en: -No one knows how to arrange them. -[Mustafa] Mm.
translation.ja: 〈誰も知らないんだ〉

translation.en: [Ahmed] Put them all next to each other.
translation.ja: 〈隣り合わせに並べよう〉

translation.en: [Osama] Mr. Sabry!
translation.ja: 〈サブリ博士〉

translation.en: [Ahmed] What's up, Osama?
translation.ja: 〈何だ ウサマ〉

translation.en: [Osama] Foreman, there's a hole in the cliff!
translation.ja: 〈親方　崖に穴がある！〉

translation.en: [Mustafa] Mr. Sabry!
translation.ja: 〈サブリ博士〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] Have you got a flashlight?
translation.ja: 〈懐中電灯はあるか？〉

translation.en: Mahdi, get a flashlight!
translation.ja: 〈懐中電灯を！〉

translation.en: Faster, Mahdi!
translation.ja: 〈急げ マフディー〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] There's a skull.
translation.ja: 〈頭蓋骨(ずがいこつ)が〉

translation.en: -That's two, three skulls. -[Ahmed] Hmm.
translation.ja: 〈２つ… いや ３つだ〉

translation.en: Looks like a stack of burials inside.
translation.ja: 〈大勢が 埋葬されてるようだ〉

translation.en: [Ahmed] Look, boss.
translation.ja: 〈見てみて〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] Look, there's something beautiful here.
translation.ja: 〈見ろ 何か美しい物があるぞ〉

translation.en: -[Ahmed] Where? -[Mohammad] Right there!
translation.ja: 〈どこ？〉 〈あっちのほうだ〉

translation.en: Look, see? It's there!
translation.ja: 〈あっちのほうだ〉 〈本当だ〉

translation.en: Looks like a hollow of around three meters.
translation.ja: 〈直径３メートルほどの 空洞だね〉

translation.en: [in English] I think…
translation.ja: 多分―

translation.en: this hole is from around 13th and the 12th century BC.
translation.ja: この穴は紀元前13世紀から 12世紀のもの

translation.en: We now clean this to see where's the entrance of this hole?
translation.ja: 今は付近に 穴の入り口がないか見てる

translation.en: Because it must be in this area.
translation.ja: 周辺にあるはずだ

translation.en: Let's bring it all down.
translation.ja: 〈全部 崩してみよう〉

translation.en: [Mohammad] Give me your hand, Osama.
translation.ja: 〈手を貸してくれ〉

translation.en: -Very beautiful, Dr. Mohammad! -[men agreeing]
translation.ja: 〈すばらしい〉

translation.en: Clear a path.
translation.ja: 〈砂を取り除いてくれ〉

translation.en: [in English] It is a burial chamber.
translation.ja: これは埋葬室だ

translation.en: We discover in it some wooden coffins…
translation.ja: 複数の木棺と―

translation.en: …and some bones.
translation.ja: 骨を見つけた

translation.en: I think there's another entrance here, Dr. Mohammad.
translation.ja: 〈ここに もう１つ 入り口がある〉

translation.en: [in English] And we also find another hole.
translation.ja: また別の穴を見つけた

translation.en: [Osama] There's a big cavity in here.
translation.ja: 〈更に大きい空洞だ〉

translation.en: Dr. Mustafa comes and we start to find the coffin, wooden coffin.
translation.ja: ムスタファ教授が来て 木棺の調査を開始

translation.en: Let's go! One… two… three!
Lift, Hamada!
translation.ja: 〈持ち上げろ〉

translation.en: [Mustafa] The colors are beautiful, God bless.
translation.ja: 〈色がキレイだ〉
